intro: Rhinanthus alectorolophus subsp. patulus, commonly known as the slender yellow-rattle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, often in association with other wildflowers. The subspecies patulus is distinguished by its more elongated floral structure compared to other members of the species.
